Title.text: Direct energy is the energy produced and consumed by the organization within its own operations, projects and facilities. It may include energy from fuels, sunlight, wind, water, etc. for operating the equipment and vehicles, and for producing power and heat on-site. For fuels it can be measured in gigajoules.

Indirect energy is the energy produced outside the organization boundaries by the electricity suppliers, and consumed on the organization side. Indirect energy depends on the local electricity grids where the organization will operate. It is measured in gigajoules or megawatt hours.

Water is at the core of sustainable development and is critical for socio-economic development, healthy ecosystems and survival of all living beings on earth. Water withdrawal refers to the water that is drawn from a surface water or groundwater source.

Water is at the core of sustainable development and is critical for socio-economic development, healthy ecosystems and survival of all living beings on earth. Water recycled refers to treatment of waste water and reusing it.

Water is at the core of sustainable development and is critical for socio-economic development, healthy ecosystems and survival of all living beings on earth. Water discharged is measured as the quantity of water discharged to a water body or source over time.

Waste is a global concern. Effective management of waste and transitioning towards zero waste to landfill is becoming an imperative with the increasing pressure on availability of land and natural resources.

The inputs used to manufacture and package an organizationâ€™s products and services can be non-renewable materials, such as minerals, metals, oil, gas, or coal; or renewable materials, such as wood or water.
